text: Haltwhistle A69 Bridge, East is a concrete bridge across the River South Tyne at Haltwhistle in Northumberland, England. ==History== The bridge is a concrete beam bridge, which forms part of the Haltwhistle bypass and was completed in 1994. The creation of the bypass allowed the road through Haltwhistle to be detrunked shortly thereafter. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northumberland Category:Crossings of the River Tyne Category:Haltwhistle
title: Haltwhistle A69 Bridge, East
